title: Demi Sims EXCLUSIVE: TOWIE star reveals her ex Megan Barton Hanson has 'apologised' to her
text:
Demi Sims has revealed her ex girlfriend Megan Barton Hanson has apologised to her after they fell out following their split.

The TOWIE star, 23, and the Love Islander, 25, struck up a romance on E4's Celebs Go Dating but later went their separate ways with Megan admitting Demi made her question if she was actually gay or not and said they had no 'sexual chemistry'.

Speaking exclusively to MailOnline at the Elbrook Cash and Carry Charity Gala Dinner at CHAK 89 in Surrey on Thursday, Demi told how Megan reached out to her on social media to make amends.

Interview: Demi Sims, 23, has revealed her ex girlfriend Megan Barton Hanson, 25, has apologised to her after they fell out following their split

'She messaged me last week actually,' Demi said. 'I had her blocked on everything so she reached out to my sister and was like: "Can you tell Demi to unblock me?"

'She was in America at the time with her girlfriend Chelcee [Grimes]. I unblocked her because I wanted to know what she had to say and she kindly apologised for everything she had done.

'She knew she was in the wrong with everything she had done to me. She apologised and we wished each other the best. I was really shocked because I didn’t expect her to ever apologise.

'It felt really nice and it made my heart warm a bit more. I had a bitter frost towards her because of everything she did to me but when she apologised, it made everything better.'

Relationship: Megan and Demi struck up a romance on Celebs Go Dating but later split with Megan admitting Demi made her question if she was actually gay or not (pictured in July 2019)

While Megan is now in a relationship with footballer and singer-songwriter Chelcee, 27, Demi is single and hasn't dated anyone since she and the Love Island star split.

'I am completely single,' Demi said. 'I’m not dating anyone and I haven’t since Megan on Celebs Go Dating. I’m just waiting to see if anyone is going to surprise me around the corner.'

Although Megan has apologised, Demi doesn't think she will ever be able to be friends with her ex because she may start to develop romantic feelings for her again.

'The thing is, I don’t know if I could ever be her friend because I had too many deep feelings for her,' she said.

Demi said: 'She messaged me last week. I had her blocked on everything so she reached out to my sister and was like: "Can you tell Demi to unblock me?" ' (pictured in July 2019)

'Obviously, I’m always going to care about her but I don’t think I could be her friend. I think as soon as I start hanging out with her, I’d probably want to be with her again. I don’t think it’s a good route to go down.'

Demi hopes to find someone 'genuine' for her next romance and if the relationship becomes serious, she would like to bring them on TOWIE with her.

However, the reality star admitted she has to be cautious about who she dates so she can make sure they are not just in it 'for fame'.

She said: 'I want someone who’s fun and up for a laugh. I would like them to come on TOWIE with me if it’s serious.

Demi added: 'I unblocked her because I wanted to know what she had to say and she kindly apologised for everything she had done' (pictured in July 2019)

Demi said: 'She knew she was in the wrong with everything she had done to me. She apologised and we wished each other the best'

Surprise: Demi was shocked to get a message from Megan as she didn't expect her to ever apologise

Demi said: 'It felt really nice and it made my heart warm a bit more. I had a bitter frost towards her because of everything she did to me but when she apologised, it made everything better'

'I want someone who’s not just in it for fame but I would like to bring them on TOWIE. It’s going to be a hard one to find someone like that.'

Demi did not mince her words when she learned that Megan had said the Essex native made her question her sexuality and that the pair didn't have any 'sexual chemistry'.

In a previous interview with MailOnline, she said: 'I am really upset how she is belittling our relationship. For her to say there was no chemistry or spark, I know for full well that she is lying because we had a passionate relationship.

'I don't know why she has said this. She told me that she had feelings for me, that she had never felt for anyone else before - even [Megan's ex] Wes Nelson.

Romance: While Demi is currently single, Megan is dating footballer and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes, 27 (pictured in September 2019)

'She said she only looked for me in a room, so for her to say the relationship was nothing and she wasn't attracted to me is a load of s**t, to be honest.

'I'm not sure if she is trying to impress the new girl that she is with by belittling what we had. She is not being honest, so she has forced me to speak out and tell the truth.'

Demi has been a castmember on TOWIE for a year now and admitted her life has changed since she joined the show.

Future: Demi hopes to find someone 'genuine' for her next romance and if the relationship becomes serious, she would like to bring them on TOWIE with her

She credited her older sister Chloe, 37, who has been on TOWIE since 2011, for being a support to her as she adjusted to being on the programme.

'I’ve got my big sister with me and she’s always going to have my back,' she said.

'I’ve been chill because I know I have her with me. If I was starting it by myself, I would have been way more nervous.

'[My life] has changed but I suppose I was used to it before because I grew up with Chloe on it. I’m used to seeing it go on around me. But it has changed, I’m enjoying it. It’s a different lifestyle.'
